intro: Cusso abyssinica, commonly known as the Abyssinian cusso, is a species of flowering plant native to Ethiopia. It belongs to the family Rubiaceae, which includes many shrubs and herbs. The plant is characterized by its small, fragrant flowers and hairy leaves. It thrives in moist, shaded environments and is often found in forest understories. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a rare and endemic species.
